about_the_game:
It's tough, getting to know people



As an outcast seeking sanctuary and finding it already occupied by refugees, your suspicions are raised and the conclusions you draw are founded on prejudice and supposition.

Although your upbringing has instilled a fear of being seen, to discern the truth you must move closer. You find that you can observe the family through tiny gaps in the walls and floorboards.

As you come to understand why they're here and what they need, you will gradually overturn your preconceptions and instead resolve to help them however you can.

Nothing is arbitrary



You can't read or speak their language.
You can't communicate with them directly.

Careful observation and attention to detail will tell you what their life is like now, but as your investigation moves to their past and becomes more abstract, you'll need to think about daily life from each family member's perspective to fully unravel what led them here.

In your own time



You'll watch their activities from multiple perspectives over the course of several days. As you shed light on their story, you'll find ways to help them overcome their struggles and understand how they escaped from a corrupt regime.

You'll uncover secrets even they didn't know... In turn, you'll come to learn how you fit into the world.

What should you expect?

  • Peer through tiny gaps from every available angle.
  • The minimalist 3D setting changes with the time of day in many subtle ways, and almost all details have significance. You'll get to know every inch of this room.
  • Realistic character animations and well-placed sounds breathe life into each scene, while a diegetic jazzy soundtrack sets the mood.
  • Observation is paramount; you can quickly move between perspectives and through different times of day, so there's no barrier when cross-referencing details.
  • It isn't strictly necessary to take your own notes, but you might find it helpful!
  • Your investigation is open-ended; tackle questions in any order you wish within each act.
  • All solutions have enough clues so as not to be ambiguous, but there are also several types of hint to fine-tune your experience.
  • There's no harm in some educated guesswork as a last resort! All clues are summarised afterwards and kept for future reference.
  • Overwrite prejudices as you make more convincing conclusions.
  • Your hard work is immortalised in an evidence board that ties all the facts together, along with some lovely sketches, building towards the complete story.
  • Playing with a controller works just as well as with a mouse and keyboard.

Cheers!

short_description: Peer through gaps into an alpine shack, in this story-driven mystery adventure that requires logical deductions from limited perspectives. Glean clues about a family. Unravel their history. Can you piece together what led them there and shine a little hope on their fractured lives?
